original: @ga_@#/_/rdo rje bdud rtshi gsum gyi mngon🔽par rtogs pa/ @_rdo rje bdud rtshi gzhan gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa rgya gar shar phyogs kyi pan+ti
analyzed: @ga_@#/_/rdo rje bdud rtshi gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa/ @_rdo rje bdud rtshi gzhan gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa rgya gar shar phyogs kyi pan+ti
translated: The Realization of the Three Vajra Homas🔽The Realization of the Three Vajra Homas, which arose from the Vajra Homa Tantra, by the eastern Indian paṇḍita

original: ta nags kyi rin chen gyi zhal snga nas rdo rje bdud rtshi'i rgyud las byung ba pan+di ta de nyid dang lo
analyzed: ta nags kyi rin chen gyi zhal snga nas rdo rje bdud rtshi'i rgyud las byung ba pan+di ta de nyid dang lo
translated: Vanaratna. Translated by that very paṇḍita and🔽the Tibetan translator Shönu Pal.

original: tsha ba bzhon nu dpal gyi 'gyur ba bzhugs so//_@##/_/rgya gar skad du/_badza
analyzed: tsha ba bzhon nu dpal gyi 'gyur ba bzhugs so//_@##/_/rgya gar skad du/_badza
translated: In Sanskrit:🔽Vajra-homa-tri-sādhana🔽In Tibetan:

original: mi b+hi sa ma ya tri ta yo/_bod skad du/_rdo rje bdud rtshi gsum gyi mngon par
analyzed: mi b+hi sa ma ya tri ta yo/_bod skad du/_rdo rje bdud rtshi gsum gyi mngon par
translated: The Realization of the Three Vajra Homas🔽Homage to Vajradhara.

original: rtogs pa/_rdo rje 'dzin la phyag 'tshhal lo/_/rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba
analyzed: rtogs pa/_rdo rje 'dzin la phyag 'tshhal lo/_/rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng ba
translated: From the Garland of Perfect Yogatantras,🔽I will write down the three vajra homas that were not taught,

original: las ma gsungs pa'i rdo rje bdud rtshi gsum po gang yin pa ni/_rgyud las phyung
analyzed: las ma gsungs pa'i rdo rje bdud rtshi gsum po gang yin pa ni/_rgyud las phyung
translated: which arose from the tantra.🔽In the maṇḍala of the second vajra homa,

original: nas bri bar bya ste/_rdo rje bdud rtshi gnyis pa'i dkyil 'khor du/_rdo rje gur
analyzed: nas bri bar bya ste/_rdo rje bdud rtshi gnyis pa'i dkyil 'khor du/_rdo rje gur
translated: inside the Vajrapañjara,

original: gyi nang /_chos 'byung gi snying por gnas pa'i khang pa brtshegs pa'i dbus su
analyzed: gyi nang /_chos 'byung gi snying por gnas pa'i khang pa brtshegs pa'i dbus su
translated: in the center of the palace situated in the heart of the source of phenomena,

original: gsang ba'i pad+ma bdud rtshi'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du dpal bdud rtshi hum mdzad khro🔽bo'i gzugs can/_go ri kha dog dkar po'i snying gar zhabs g.yon pa gnas
analyzed: gsang ba'i pad+ma bdud rtshi'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du dpal bdud rtshi hum mdzad khro bo'i gzugs can/_go ri kha dog dkar po'i snying gar zhabs g.yon pa gnas
translated: On the mandala of the secret lotus, which is the place of the rasanā, is glorious Vajraraudra Hūṃkāra,🔽who has the form of a wrathful deity.🔽The foot that is the sport of the left foot is at the heart of white Gaurī.🔽The body is blue, and the right and left faces are

original: pa'i rol pa'i zhabs/_sku mdog sngon po rtsha ba dang g.yas dang g.yon gyi gyi zhal
analyzed: pa'i rol pa'i zhabs/_sku mdog sngon po rtsha ba dang g.yas dang g.yon gyi gyi zhal

original: rdo rje bdud rtshi gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa/
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtshi gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa/
translated: This is the clear realization of Vajraraudra.🔽The three faces are blue, white, and red.

original: gsum po sngon po dang dkar po dang dmar po ste/_zhal dang po mche ba cung zad
analyzed: gsum po sngon po dang dkar po dang dmar po ste/_zhal dang po mche ba cung zad
translated: The first face has slightly bared fangs,

original: gtshigs pa/_drag tu cher bzhad pa dang bcas pa/_phyag drug pa rtsha ba'i phyag
analyzed: gtshigs pa/_drag tu cher bzhad pa dang bcas pa/_phyag drug pa rtsha ba'i phyag
translated: and it is laughing with a fierce, loud ha ha ha ha.🔽The six hands hold the mudra of Vajrahūṃkāra.

original: dag gis rdo rje hum mdzad kyi phyag rgya 'chang ba ste phyag gnyis po phan tshhun rgyab sbyar
analyzed: dag gis rdo rje hum mdzad kyi phyag rgya 'chang ba ste phyag gnyis po phan tshhun rgyab sbyar

original: ba mthe'u chung mdud cing /_sdigs mdzub bsgreng ba ni rdo rje hum mdzad kyi phyag
analyzed: ba mthe'u chung mdud cing /_sdigs mdzub bsgreng ba ni rdo rje hum mdzad kyi phyag
translated: This is the mudra of Vajrahūṃkāra.

original: rgya'o/_/g.yas dang g.yon dag gis mda' dang gzhu dag bsnams pa/
analyzed: rgya'o/_/g.yas dang g.yon dag gis mda' dang gzhu dag bsnams pa/

translated: Others hold Kali's breasts, a vajra spear, a skull,

analyzed: po'i zhal gsum ma/_rtsha ba'i phyag dag gis snying gar rdo rje 'dzin pa/_g.yas

translated: In the second ring, in the east is red Venuvana,🔽with red, white, and black faces. She holds a flute, a bow and arrow, and a gesture of homage.🔽In the south is yellow Veṇu,

analyzed: pa'i phyag_/dbang ldan du/_sgeg mo dmar mo/_dmar po dang /_dkar

analyzed: sngon po'i mdog phyag na ral gri/_phyag na rin chen dmar po phyag na rin che/ nub tu kun tu bzang po'i gser mdog phyag g.yas na me tog_/'jig rten
translated: In the east, Mañjuśrī is blue, holding a sword in his hand; Avalokiteśvara is red, holding a jewel in his hand; and Vajrapāṇi is yellow, holding a vajra in his hand.🔽In the south, Samantabhadra is golden, holding a flower in his right hand;🔽Lokeśvara is crystal-like, holding a lotus and making the boon-granting gesture; and Nivāraṇaviṣkambhin is white, holding a sword in his right hand and a jewel in his left.

original: dbang phyug shel lta bu mchog sbyin dang pad+ma'i phyag_/byang du sgrib pa thams cad🔽rdo rje bdud rtshi gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa/🔽rnam par sel ba gser gyi mdog phyag g.yas dri ba'i tshhul/_phyag g.yon pa kur
analyzed: dbang phyug shel lta bu mchog sbyin dang pad+ma'i phyag_/byang du sgrib pa thams cad rdo rje bdud rtshi gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa/ rnam par sel ba gser gyi mdog phyag g.yas dri ba'i tshhul/_phyag g.yon pa kur
translated: In the west, Mañjuśrī is golden, holding a flower in his right hand;🔽Lokeśvara is crystal-like, holding a lotus and making the boon-granting gesture; and Nivāraṇaviṣkambhin is white, holding a sword in his right hand and a jewel in his left.🔽In the north, Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin is blue, holding a sword in his right hand and a jewel in his left.🔽Vighustarāja is golden, holding a perfume casket in his right hand and a lotus in his left.

original: brten pa/_sa'i snying po ljang gu g.yas phyogs su thal mo sbyar ba/_dbang ldan
analyzed: brten pa/_sa'i snying po ljang gu g.yas phyogs su thal mo sbyar ba/_dbang ldan
translated: Kṣitigarbha is green, with his right hand in the gesture of supplication.

original: du dri ma dmar mo dmar ba dang dkar ba dang nag po'i zhal/_rtsha ba'i phyag
analyzed: du dri ma dmar mo dmar ba dang dkar ba dang nag po'i zhal/_rtsha ba'i phyag
translated: In the northeast, Pāṇḍaravāsinī has red, white, and black faces, holding a perfume conch with her right hand,

original: gis dri'i dung /_gnyis pa dag gis thal mo sbyar ba/_gzhan dag gis gzhu
analyzed: gis dri'i dung /_gnyis pa dag gis thal mo sbyar ba/_gzhan dag gis gzhu
translated: her two hands in añjali at her heart, and holding a bow and arrow with the other two.

analyzed: dang mda' bsnams pa/_mer me tog ma dkar mo dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po'i zhal/_thal mo spyi bor sbyar ba/_me tog gi snod dang /_gzhu dang mda' dang 'khor lo'i phyag_/bden bral du bdug spos ma du ba'i mdog dud
translated: At the southwest corner, Incense Lady has the color of smoke,

original: kha dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_bdug spos kyi snod dang thal mo spyi bor
analyzed: kha dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_bdug spos kyi snod dang thal mo spyi bor
translated: with smoke, white, and red faces,🔽her palms joined at her crown,

original: sbyar ba/_gzhu dang mda' dang 'khor lo'i phyag_/rlung du mar me ma gser gyi
analyzed: sbyar ba/_gzhu dang mda' dang 'khor lo'i phyag_/rlung du mar me ma gser gyi
translated: holding an incense vessel, bow, arrow, and chakram.🔽At the northwest corner, Lamp Lady is the color of gold,

original: mdog gser dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_kong bu dang bcas pa'i thal
analyzed: mdog gser dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_kong bu dang bcas pa'i thal
translated: with gold, white, and red faces,🔽her palms joined in a lamp gesture,

original: mo sbyar ba/_mda' dang gzhu dang rdo rje dang 'khor lo'i phyag_/shar gyi sgor
analyzed: mo sbyar ba/_mda' dang gzhu dang rdo rje dang 'khor lo'i phyag_/shar gyi sgor
translated: holding a bow, arrow, vajra, and chakram.

original: lcags kyu dmar po dmar po dang dkar po dang /_dmar ser gyi zhal/
analyzed: lcags kyu dmar po dmar po dang dkar po dang /_dmar ser gyi zhal/
translated: At the northeast corner, red Hook Lady has red, white, and orange faces,

original: lcags kyu dang ral gri dang mda' dang gzhu dang sdigs mdzub dang 'khor lo
analyzed: lcags kyu dang ral gri dang mda' dang gzhu dang sdigs mdzub dang 'khor lo
translated: holding a hook, sword, arrow, bow, threatening gesture, and chakram.

original: 'dzin pa'i phyag_/lhor rdo rje zhags pa dkar po/_dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po'i zhal/_zhags pa dang ral gri dang mda' dang gzhu dang sdigs mdzub
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i phyag_/lhor rdo rje zhags pa dkar po/_dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po'i zhal/_zhags pa dang ral gri dang mda' dang gzhu dang sdigs mdzub
translated: In the south is white Vajrapāśa, with white, black, and red faces, holding a noose, sword, arrow, bow, and threatening gesture

analyzed: dang rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyag_/nub tu rdo rje lcags sgrog ser po/_ser po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_gnyis dag gis lcags sgrog dang /_gzhu dang mda' dang /_ral gri dang sdigs mdzub kyi phyag_/byang du rdo rje dril bu ljang gu ljang gu dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_dril bu dang ral gri dang mda' dang gzhu dang /_sdigs mdzub dang rdo rje'i phyag_/sgo skyong bzhi po khro
translated: with a vajra-holding hand. In the west is yellow Vajrāṅkuśa, with yellow, white, and red faces, holding a goad, bow, arrow, sword, and threatening gesture🔽with a vajra-holding hand. In the north is green Vajrasphoṭa, with green, white, and red faces, holding a bell, sword, arrow, bow, and threatening gesture

original: bo'i gzugs can/_rdo rje dregs ma la sogs pa rdo rje dril bu'i mthar thug pa'i🔽lha rnams ni rdo rje bdud rtshi'i glegs bam gyis mtshhan pa'i cod pan/_sna tshhogs
analyzed: bo'i gzugs can/_rdo rje dregs ma la sogs pa rdo rje dril bu'i mthar thug pa'i🔽lha rnams ni rdo rje bdud rtshi'i glegs bam gyis mtshhan pa'i cod pan/_sna tshhogs
translated: with a vajra-holding hand. The four gate protectors have wrathful forms. Vajrāveśa and so on, ending with Vajraghaṇṭā,🔽have crowns marked with the book of Vajra Amṛta. The various

original: pa'i rin po ches brgyan pa/_zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rol pa'i gdan
analyzed: pa'i rin po ches brgyan pa/_zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rol pa'i gdan
translated: They are adorned with precious jewels and are seated on moon discs.

original: rang mdog dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor can rnams so/_/
analyzed: rang mdog dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor can rnams so/_/
translated: They are surrounded by halos of light that correspond to their individual colors.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje bdud rtshi'i sngags ni/_hum zhes pa'o/_/rdo rje bdud rtshi
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje bdud rtshi'i sngags ni/_hum zhes pa'o/_/rdo rje bdud rtshi
translated: The mantra of Bhagavat Vajra Amṛta is hūṃ.

original: gsum pa'i dkyil 'khor du/_rdo rje gur gyi nang du/_chos 'byung gi snying
analyzed: gsum pa'i dkyil 'khor du/_rdo rje gur gyi nang du/_chos 'byung gi snying
translated: In the maṇḍala of the third empowerment, inside the vajra tent, in the heart of the source of phenomena,

original: por gnas pa'i khang pa brtshegs pa'i dbus su sna tshhogs pad+mar nyi ma'i steng du/🔽bcom ldan 'das he ru ka sngon po khro bo'i gzugs can/_sngon po dang /_dud
analyzed: por gnas pa'i khang pa brtshegs pa'i dbus su sna tshhogs pad+mar nyi ma'i steng du/ bcom ldan 'das he ru ka sngon po khro bo'i gzugs can/_sngon po dang /_dud
translated: in the center of a tiered house, on a multicolored lotus and sun,🔽is Bhagavat Heruka, blue, with a wrathful form, with four faces—blue, smoky,

original: kha dang /_ser po dang /_dkar po'i zhal bzhi pa/_phyag brgyad pa/_rtsha ba
analyzed: kha dang /_ser po dang /_dkar po'i zhal bzhi pa/_phyag brgyad pa/_rtsha ba
translated: yellow, and white—and eight arms. He is wrathful,

original: dag gis 'bar ba'i phyag rgya bcas pa/_g.yas rnams na rdo rje dang rgyu ma dang mgo bo dang rtshe gsum rnams so/_/g.yon rnams na kha tam ga dang thod pa dang srin po'i mgrin pa nas bcangs pa dang rus pa'i phreng ba 'dzin pa'o/_/mche ba🔽gtshigs shing thod pa'i phreng ba dang /_rdo rje bdud rtshi'i glegs bam gyis mtshhan
analyzed: dag gis 'bar ba'i phyag rgya bcas pa/_g.yas rnams na rdo rje dang rgyu ma dang mgo bo dang rtshe gsum rnams so/_/g.yon rnams na kha tam ga dang thod pa dang srin po'i mgrin pa nas bcangs pa dang rus pa'i phreng ba 'dzin pa'o/_/mche ba gtshigs shing thod pa'i phreng ba dang /_rdo rje bdud rtshi'i glegs bam gyis mtshhan
translated: The right hands hold a vajra, intestines, head, and heart. The left hands hold a khaṭvāṅga, skull cup, and a garland of heads by the hair, and make a threatening gesture with a finger.🔽She has a garland of dry heads and a crown ornament marked with a vajra cross and a book.

original: pa'i cod pan/_sgyu ma'i phreng bas phreng bar byas pa/_sna tshhogs pa'i rgyan
analyzed: pa'i cod pan/_sgyu ma'i phreng bas phreng bar byas pa/_sna tshhogs pa'i rgyan
translated: She is garlanded with a garland of magical emanations and is adorned with various ornaments.

original: gyis brgyan pa/_rol pa'i gdan shes rab ma med pa'o/_/shar du gtshigs pa
analyzed: gyis brgyan pa/_rol pa'i gdan shes rab ma med pa'o/_/shar du gtshigs pa
translated: She stands in a dancing posture without a wisdom consort.

original: dang bcas pa ma ser mo/_ser po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal phyag
analyzed: dang bcas pa ma ser mo/_ser po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal phyag
translated: In the east is yellow Gaṇapati, with yellow, white, and red faces.

original: g.yas dang cig shos kyi phyag drug rnams ni/_ral gri dang rdo rje dang mgo bo dang kha tam ga dang thod pa dang rus pa'i phreng ba 'dzin pa/_lho ru gtshigs pa ma
analyzed: g.yas dang cig shos kyi phyag drug rnams ni/_ral gri dang rdo rje dang mgo bo dang kha tam ga dang thod pa dang rus pa'i phreng ba 'dzin pa/_lho ru gtshigs pa ma
translated: The six right and left hands hold a sword, a vajra, a head, a khaṭvāṅga, a skull cup, and a garland of bones.

original: dkar mo dkar po dang sngon po dang dmar po'i zhal/_ral gri dang rus pa'i
analyzed: dkar mo dkar po dang sngon po dang dmar po'i zhal/_ral gri dang rus pa'i
translated: In the south, Aṭṭahāsinī is white, with blue and red faces.

original: phreng ba dang /_rdo rje dang kha tam ga dang thod pa dang mgo 'dzin pa'i phyag_/
analyzed: phreng ba dang /_rdo rje dang kha tam ga dang thod pa dang mgo 'dzin pa'i phyag_/
translated: She holds a sword, a garland of bones, a vajra, a khaṭvāṅga, a skull cup, and a head.

original: nub tu gtum mo sngon mo sngon po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_ral gri
analyzed: nub tu gtum mo sngon mo sngon po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_ral gri
translated: In the west, Caṇḍālī is blue, with blue, white, and red faces.

original: dang rdo rje dang mgo bo dang rgyu ma'i phreng ba dang kha tam ga dang thod pa 'dzin pa'i
analyzed: dang rdo rje dang mgo bo dang rgyu ma'i phreng ba dang kha tam ga dang thod pa 'dzin pa'i
translated: She holds a sword, a vajra, a head, a garland of intestines, a khaṭvāṅga, and a skull cup.

original: rdo rje bdud rtshi gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa/
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtshi gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa/
translated: This is the clear realization of Vajra Amṛta.

original: phyag_/byang du g.yung mo du ba'i mdog_/dud kha dang dkar po dang dmar
analyzed: phyag_/byang du g.yung mo du ba'i mdog_/dud kha dang dkar po dang dmar
translated: In the north, Ḍombinī is the color of smoke, with smoky, white, and red faces.

original: po'i zhal/_ral gri dang rus pa'i phreng ba dang /_rdo rje dang kha tam ga dang mgo
analyzed: po'i zhal/_ral gri dang rus pa'i phreng ba dang /_rdo rje dang kha tam ga dang mgo
translated: She holds a sword, a garland of bones, a vajra, a khaṭvāṅga, a skull cup, and a head.

original: bo dang thod pa 'dzin pa'i phyag_/dbang ldan du drag mo sngon mo sngon po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal ral gri dang rgyu ma'i phreng ba dang kha tam ga dang thod
analyzed: bo dang thod pa 'dzin pa'i phyag_/dbang ldan du drag mo sngon mo sngon po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal ral gri dang rgyu ma'i phreng ba dang kha tam ga dang thod
translated: In the northeast, blue Raudrī has blue, white, and red faces and holds a sword, entrails garland, khaṭvāṅga, and skull cup in her four hands.

original: pa dang mgo bo 'dzin pa'i phyag_/mer ser skya ma dmar po dang dkar po dang nag po'i zhal/_ral gri dang rgyu ma'i phreng ba dang rdo rje dang kha tam ga dang thod pa🔽dang srin po'i mgrin pa nas 'dzin pa'i phyag_/bden bral du rigs can nag🔽mo dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_ral gri dang mgo bo dang rtshe gsum dang kha kha ga dang thod pa dang rgyu ma'i phreng ba 'dzin pa'i phyag_/rlung du drag mo ser
analyzed: pa dang mgo bo 'dzin pa'i phyag_/mer ser skya ma dmar po dang dkar po dang nag po'i zhal/_ral gri dang rgyu ma'i phreng ba dang rdo rje dang kha tam ga dang thod pa dang srin po'i mgrin pa nas 'dzin pa'i phyag_/bden bral du rigs can nag mo dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_ral gri dang mgo bo dang rtshe gsum dang kha kha ga dang thod pa dang rgyu ma'i phreng ba 'dzin pa'i phyag_/rlung du drag mo ser
translated: In the southeast, yellow Pīlavajrā has red, white, and black faces and holds a sword, entrails garland, vajra, khaṭvāṅga, skull cup, and the throat of a rākṣasa in her four hands.🔽In the southwest, black Kuleśvarī has black, white, and red faces and holds a sword, head, trident, khaṭvāṅga, skull cup, and entrails garland in her four hands.

original: mo ser po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal ral gri dang rdo rje dang rus pa'i
analyzed: mo ser po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal ral gri dang rdo rje dang rus pa'i
translated: In the northwest, yellow Caṇḍālī has yellow, white, and red faces and holds a sword, skull cup, khaṭvāṅga, and entrails garland in her four hands.

original: phreng ba dang kha tam ga dang thod pa dang srin po 'dzin pa'i phyag go/_/rim pa
analyzed: phreng ba dang kha tam ga dang thod pa dang srin po 'dzin pa'i phyag go/_/rim pa
translated: She has a garland, khaṭvāṅga, skull cup, and a rākṣasa in her hands.

original: gnyis pa la/_shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su/_me tog ma dang / bdug pa ma dang /_mar me ma dang /_dri ma rnams rim pas/_dkar mo
analyzed: gnyis pa la/_shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su/_me tog ma dang / bdug pa ma dang /_mar me ma dang /_dri ma rnams rim pas/_dkar mo
translated: On the second level, in the east and so on, are the goddesses of flowers, incense, light, and perfume, who are white,

original: dang nag mo dang ser mo dang dmar mo'i mdog_/zhal gcig ma phyag gnyis ma/
analyzed: dang nag mo dang ser mo dang dmar mo'i mdog_/zhal gcig ma phyag gnyis ma/
translated: black, yellow, and red, with one face and two arms.

original: g.yas rnams kyis me tog dang bdug spos dang mar me dang dri'i snod 'dzin pa/
analyzed: g.yas rnams kyis me tog dang bdug spos dang mar me dang dri'i snod 'dzin pa/
translated: With their right hands they hold flowers, incense, lamps, and perfume containers.

original: kha tam ga dang g.yon gyi dpung par brten pa'i phyag der rdo rje 'dzin pa/_dbang
analyzed: kha tam ga dang g.yon gyi dpung par brten pa'i phyag der rdo rje 'dzin pa/_dbang
translated: They hold khaṭvāṅgas and vajras in their left hands, which rest on their left thighs.

original: ldan la sogs pa'i mtshhams rnams su/_gling bu ma dang /_pi wang ma dang / ku mun+da ma dang /_mur dza ma rnams/_ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po
analyzed: ldan la sogs pa'i mtshhams rnams su/_gling bu ma dang /_pi wang ma dang / ku mun+da ma dang /_mur dza ma rnams/_ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po
translated: In the intermediate directions beginning with the northeast are the goddesses of the flute, lute, small drum, and cymbals, who are yellow, red, white,

original: dang du ba'i mdog_/kha tam ga g.yon gyi gru mor brten pa'i phyag der rdo rje 'dzin
analyzed: dang du ba'i mdog_/kha tam ga g.yon gyi gru mor brten pa'i phyag der rdo rje 'dzin
translated: and smoke-colored. They hold khaṭvāṅgas and vajras in their left hands, which rest on their left thighs.

original: pa/_g.yas rnams kyis gling bu 'bud pa la sogs pa'i tshhul lo/_/shar gyi
analyzed: pa/_g.yas rnams kyis gling bu 'bud pa la sogs pa'i tshhul lo/_/shar gyi
translated: The right hands hold a flute and so forth.

original: sgor ba lang gi rna ba dkar po/_lhor glang po'i rna ba dmar po/_nub tu
analyzed: sgor ba lang gi rna ba dkar po/_lhor glang po'i rna ba dmar po/_nub tu
translated: At the eastern gate is white Gavaja, at the southern gate is red Gajana,

original: bzhin bzangs ser po/_byang du bzhin ngan dud kha ste sgo skyong rnams zhal
analyzed: bzhin bzangs ser po/_byang du bzhin ngan dud kha ste sgo skyong rnams zhal
translated: at the western gate is yellow Subhadra, and at the northern gate is smoke-colored Durbhadra.

original: gcig pa phyag gnyis pa/_rim pas g.yas dang g.yon dag gi lcags kyu dang / zhags pa dang /_lcags sgrog dang /_dril bu 'dzin pa rnams so/_/dkyil
analyzed: gcig pa phyag gnyis pa/_rim pas g.yas dang g.yon dag gi lcags kyu dang / zhags pa dang /_lcags sgrog dang /_dril bu 'dzin pa rnams so/_/dkyil
translated: All the gate guardians have one face and two arms, holding a hook and a lasso in the right and left hands, respectively, and a chain and a bell.

original: 'khor pa thams cad drag cing sna tshhogs pa'i rgyan dang rdo rje dang gtshug gi nor
analyzed: 'khor pa thams cad drag cing sna tshhogs pa'i rgyan dang rdo rje dang gtshug gi nor
translated: All the deities of the mandala are fierce, with various ornaments, a vajra crest, and a crown of human heads.

original: bu'i cod pan/_'od dmar po glu len pa'i tshhul dang gar byed pa'i tshhul can
analyzed: bu'i cod pan/_'od dmar po glu len pa'i tshhul dang gar byed pa'i tshhul can
translated: They are surrounded by a red halo and are dancing and singing.🔽They all stand on seats of skulls.🔽The mantra of the wrathful Heruka and his retinue is:

original: rnams te thod pa'i phreng ba'i gdan la gnas par bya'o/_/he ru ka 'khor dang bcas pa'i rtsha ba'i sngags ni/_om dz+wa la dz+wa la hu~m phat b+h+yoh swa ha/_zhes pa'o/_/
analyzed: rnams te thod pa'i phreng ba'i gdan la gnas par bya'o/_/he ru ka 'khor dang bcas pa'i rtsha ba'i sngags ni/_om dz+wa la dz+wa la hu~m phat b+h+yoh swa ha/_zhes pa'o/_/
translated: om jvala jvala hum phat bhyoah svaha.

original: rdo rje bdud rtshi'i bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor du/_rdo rje gur gyi nang du chos 'byung
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtshi'i bzhi pa'i dkyil 'khor du/_rdo rje gur gyi nang du chos 'byung
translated: In the mandala of the fourth section of Vajra Apagchun,

original: gi snying po gnas pa'i khang pa brtshegs pa'i dbus su/_chos 'byung gi steng du
analyzed: gi snying po gnas pa'i khang pa brtshegs pa'i dbus su/_chos 'byung gi steng du
translated: inside the Vajra Tent, in the center of a tiered palace, in the heart of the source of phenomena,🔽upon a lotus with eight petals above the source of phenomena,

original: mdab ma brgyad pa'i pad+ma la bzhugs shing rol pa'i g.yon pa'i zhabs kyis log
analyzed: mdab ma brgyad pa'i pad+ma la bzhugs shing rol pa'i g.yon pa'i zhabs kyis log
translated: he sits in the dance posture, with his left foot pressing down on🔽the heretic.

original: 'dren gnon par mdzad pa'i dpal rdo rje bdud rtshi nag po khro bo chen po'i
analyzed: 'dren gnon par mdzad pa'i dpal rdo rje bdud rtshi nag po khro bo chen po'i
translated: He is the glorious Black Vajra Apagchun, the great wrathful one,

original: gzugs can/_nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_phyag drug gi🔽g.yas rnams kyis dgra sta dang rdo rje dang ral gri/_g.yon rnams kyis sdigs
analyzed: gzugs can/_nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_phyag drug gi g.yas rnams kyis dgra sta dang rdo rje dang ral gri/_g.yon rnams kyis sdigs
translated: with a black, white, and red face, and six arms.🔽The right hands hold an axe, a vajra, and a sword;🔽the left hands hold a threatening forefinger, a pestle, and a lasso.

original: mdzub dang gtun shing dang zhags pa bsnams pa/_drag po chen po mche ba rnam
analyzed: mdzub dang gtun shing dang zhags pa bsnams pa/_drag po chen po mche ba rnam
translated: He has very bared fangs,

original: par gtshig pa spyan ser skya/_'bar ba'i sma ra ser po/_skra gyen du brjes pa/
analyzed: par gtshig pa spyan ser skya/_'bar ba'i sma ra ser po/_skra gyen du brjes pa/
translated: yellow eyes, a yellow blazing moustache, and hair standing upward.🔽His hair is marked with a book of Vajra Apagchun,

original: rdo rje bdud rtshi'i glegs bam gyis mtshhan pa'i skra/_lus thung zhing /_gsus pa
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtshi'i glegs bam gyis mtshhan pa'i skra/_lus thung zhing /_gsus pa
translated: his body is short, and his belly is big.

original: 'phyang ba/_'od dmar po'i dkyil 'khor can/_shes rab ma med pa'o/_/
analyzed: 'phyang ba/_'od dmar po'i dkyil 'khor can/_shes rab ma med pa'o/_/
translated: She is naked, with a red halo, and without a wisdom-consort.🔽In the east is blue Aśokakāntā, with blue, white, and red faces, holding a lotus, aśoka branch, vajra, battle-ax, lasso, and threatening gesture with her six hands.

original: shar du bdud rtshi ma sngon mo sngon po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal pad+ma dang bdud rtshi'i snod dang /_rdo rje dang /_dgra sta dang /_zhags pa dang / sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/lho ru/_bdud rtshi'i zhal ma pri yang ku ltar
analyzed: shar du bdud rtshi ma sngon mo sngon po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal pad+ma dang bdud rtshi'i snod dang /_rdo rje dang /_dgra sta dang /_zhags pa dang / sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/lho ru/_bdud rtshi'i zhal ma pri yang ku ltar
translated: In the south is blue Aśokamukhī, with blue, white, and red faces like a blue lily.🔽She holds a vajra, aśoka branch, mirror marked with a face and a lotus, battle-ax, lasso, pestle, and threatening gesture with her six hands.

original: sngo bsangs/_pri yang ku ltar sngo bsangs dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/🔽rdo rje bdud rtshi gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa/
analyzed: sngo bsangs/_pri yang ku ltar sngo bsangs dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/ rdo rje bdud rtshi gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa/
translated: In the west is blue Aśokakāyī, with blue, white, and red faces like a blue lotus.

original: pad+ma dang /_gdong gis mtshhan pa'i me long dang dgra sta dang /_zhags pa dang / gtun shin dang /_sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/nub tu bdud rtshi'i lus ma/🔽ut+pal sngon po'i mdog_/ut+pal sngon po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/
analyzed: pad+ma dang /_gdong gis mtshhan pa'i me long dang dgra sta dang /_zhags pa dang / gtun shin dang /_sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/nub tu bdud rtshi'i lus ma/🔽ut+pal sngon po'i mdog_/ut+pal sngon po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/
translated: She holds a lotus, aśoka branch, mirror marked with a face and a lotus, battle-ax, lasso, pestle, and threatening gesture with her six hands.

original: pad+ma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang ral gri dang dgra sta dang zhags pa dang /_sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/byang du bdud
analyzed: pad+ma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du sangs rgyas kyi gzugs dang ral gri dang dgra sta dang zhags pa dang /_sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/byang du bdud
translated: holding a lotus, a sword, a vajra, a battle-ax,🔽a lasso, and a threatening gesture.

original: rtshi'i spyan ma dkar mo/_dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po'i zhal/_pad+ma
analyzed: rtshi'i spyan ma dkar mo/_dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po'i zhal/_pad+ma
translated: In the southeast, there is Aparimitā, blue like the sky, with a sky-blue, white, and red face,🔽holding a lotus, a sword, a wheel, a battle-ax,🔽a lasso, and a threatening gesture.🔽In the south, there is Aparājitā, white, with white, black, and red faces,

original: dang mig gis mtshhan pa'i zla ba dang ral gri dang zhags pa dang dgra sta dang / sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/dbang ldan du bde sgrub ma dmar mo/_dmar
analyzed: dang mig gis mtshhan pa'i zla ba dang ral gri dang zhags pa dang dgra sta dang / sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/dbang ldan du bde sgrub ma dmar mo/_dmar
translated: holding a lotus, a sword, a wheel, a battle-ax,🔽a lasso, and a threatening gesture.🔽In the southwest, there is Mahāmantrānusāriṇī, yellow, with yellow, black, and red faces,

original: po dang dkar po dang nag po'i zhal/_pad+ma dang ral gri dang rdo rje dang dgra sta
analyzed: po dang dkar po dang nag po'i zhal/_pad+ma dang ral gri dang rdo rje dang dgra sta
translated: holding a lotus, a sword, a wheel, a battle-ax,🔽a lasso, and a threatening gesture.🔽In the northwest, there is Mahābalā, green, with green, black, and red faces,🔽holding a lotus, a sword, a wheel, a battle-ax,

original: dang zhags pa dang sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/mer dpag med ma nam
analyzed: dang zhags pa dang sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/mer dpag med ma nam
translated: a lasso, and a threatening gesture.

original: mkha' ltar sngo bsangs/_nam mkha' ltar sngo bsangs dang dkar po dang dmar
analyzed: mkha' ltar sngo bsangs/_nam mkha' ltar sngo bsangs dang dkar po dang dmar
translated: In the northeast, there is Mahāvīryā, blue like the sky, with a sky-blue, white, and red face,🔽holding a lotus, a sword, a wheel, a battle-ax,🔽a lasso, and a threatening gesture.

original: po'i zhal/_pad+ma dang ral gri dang btun shing dang zhags pa dang dgra sta dang / sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/bden bral du gzugs mdzes ma gser gyi
analyzed: po'i zhal/_pad+ma dang ral gri dang btun shing dang zhags pa dang dgra sta dang / sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/bden bral du gzugs mdzes ma gser gyi
translated: His faces are white, black, red, yellow, and green. He has eight hands holding a lotus, sword, khaṭvāṅga, lasso, battle-ax, and threatening gesture.

original: mdog gser dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_pad+ma dang rdo rje dang ral gri
analyzed: mdog gser dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_pad+ma dang rdo rje dang ral gri
translated: In the southwest, beautiful form is golden, with golden, white, and red faces.

original: dang dgra sta dang zhags pa dang /_sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/rlung du sna
analyzed: dang dgra sta dang zhags pa dang /_sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/rlung du sna
translated: She has eight hands holding a lotus, vajra, sword, battle-ax, lasso, and threatening gesture.

original: bzang ma mdog ser skya/_ser skya dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_pad+ma🔽dang rdo rje dang ral gri dang dgra sta dang zhags pa dang /_sdigs mdzub 'dzin
analyzed: bzang ma mdog ser skya/_ser skya dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_pad+ma dang rdo rje dang ral gri dang dgra sta dang zhags pa dang /_sdigs mdzub 'dzin
translated: In the northwest, excellent smell is pale yellow, with pale yellow, white, and red faces.🔽She has eight hands holding a lotus, vajra, sword, battle-ax, lasso, and threatening gesture.

original: pa'i phyag ste thams cad rdo rje gtshug gi nor bur 'dzin zhing gar byed pa'i tshhul
analyzed: pa'i phyag ste thams cad rdo rje gtshug gi nor bur 'dzin zhing gar byed pa'i tshhul
translated: All of them hold vajra-bolts in their sex organs and are in dancing posture.

original: can rnams so/_/shar gyi sgor rdo rje lcags kyu dmar po/_dmar po dang dkar
analyzed: can rnams so/_/shar gyi sgor rdo rje lcags kyu dmar po/_dmar po dang dkar
translated: At the eastern gate is red Vajra Hook, with red, white, and

original: po dang nag po'i zhal/_lcags kyu dang rdo rje dang ral gri dang btun shing dang dgra sta dang /_sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/lhor rdo rje zhags pa ser po/
analyzed: po dang nag po'i zhal/_lcags kyu dang rdo rje dang ral gri dang btun shing dang dgra sta dang /_sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/lhor rdo rje zhags pa ser po/
translated: He has black and white faces, and he holds a hook, a vajra, a sword, a pestle, an ax, and a threatening gesture with his right hands.🔽In the south is yellow Vajra Rope.

original: ser po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_zhags pa dang ral gri dang rdo rje🔽dang gtun shing dang dgra sta dang sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/nub tu rdo rje
analyzed: ser po dang dkar po dang dmar po'i zhal/_zhags pa dang ral gri dang rdo rje dang gtun shing dang dgra sta dang sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag_/nub tu rdo rje
translated: He has yellow, white, and red faces, and he holds a noose, a sword, a vajra, a pestle, an ax, and a threatening gesture with his right hands.🔽In the west is white Vajra Lock.

original: lcags sgrog dkar po/_dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po'i zhal/_lcags🔽sgrog dang ral gri dang rdo rje dang dgra sta dang gtun shing dang sdigs mdzub 'dzin
analyzed: lcags sgrog dkar po/_dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po'i zhal/_lcags sgrog dang ral gri dang rdo rje dang dgra sta dang gtun shing dang sdigs mdzub 'dzin
translated: He has white, black, and red faces, and he holds a lock, a sword, a vajra, an ax, a pestle, and a threatening gesture with his right hands.🔽In the north is green Vajra Bell.

original: pa'i phyag_/byang du rdo rje dril bu ljang gu/_ljang gu dang nag po dang dmar
analyzed: pa'i phyag_/byang du rdo rje dril bu ljang gu/_ljang gu dang nag po dang dmar
translated: He has green, black, and red faces, and he holds a bell, a sword, a vajra, an ax, a pestle, and a threatening gesture with his right hands.

original: po'i zhal/_dril bu dang rdo rje dang ral gri dang dgra sta dang gtun shing dang / sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag ste/_sgo skyong thams cad mche ba cher gtshigs pa/
analyzed: po'i zhal/_dril bu dang rdo rje dang ral gri dang dgra sta dang gtun shing dang / sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa'i phyag ste/_sgo skyong thams cad mche ba cher gtshigs pa/
translated: All the gate guardians have bared fangs,

original: 'bar ba'i smra ra ser po/_rdo rje bdud rtshi'i glegs bam cod pan du bya'o/_/
analyzed: 'bar ba'i smra ra ser po/_rdo rje bdud rtshi'i glegs bam cod pan du bya'o/_/
translated: fierce yellow hair, and a vajra-handled sword and book.

original: bdud rtshi ma la sogs pa rdo rje dril bu'i mthar thug pa'i lha thams cad khros pa'i
analyzed: bdud rtshi ma la sogs pa rdo rje dril bu'i mthar thug pa'i lha thams cad khros pa'i
translated: All the deities from Amṛtakuṇḍali up to the vajra and bell are wrathful forms,

original: sku can sna tshhogs pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/_rol pa'i stabs kyis gnas pa/
analyzed: sku can sna tshhogs pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/_rol pa'i stabs kyis gnas pa/
translated: adorned with various ornaments, standing in a dancing posture,

original: 'od dmar po rnams su bya'o/_/bdud rtshi 'khyil pa 'khor dang bcas pa'i rtsha
analyzed: 'od dmar po rnams su bya'o/_/bdud rtshi 'khyil pa 'khor dang bcas pa'i rtsha
translated: and surrounded by a red halo.🔽The mantra of Amṛtakuṇḍali and his retinue is:

original: ba'i sngags ni/_om a mri ta kun+da li a mam swa ha/_dkyil 'khor gsum po 'di
analyzed: ba'i sngags ni/_om a mri ta kun+da li a mam swa ha/_dkyil 'khor gsum po 'di
translated: Oṃ amṛtakuṇḍali amaraṃ svāhā.🔽The colors of these three maṇḍalas are taught in the Garland of the Perfect Yoga as follows:

original: rnams kyi kha dog ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng bar gsungs pa'i rdo rje bdud
analyzed: rnams kyi kha dog ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi phreng bar gsungs pa'i rdo rje bdud
translated: The vajra-handled sword and book

original: rtshi dang po'i phyogs mdog gi rim pas shes par bya'o/_/rdo rje bdud rtshi'i dkyil🔽'khor gsum pa rdzogs so//_//
analyzed: rtshi dang po'i phyogs mdog gi rim pas shes par bya'o/_/rdo rje bdud rtshi'i dkyil 'khor gsum pa rdzogs so//_//
translated: One should understand this by the sequence of the colors of the directions of the first mandala.🔽The third mandala of Vajra Amṛta is complete.

original: rdo rje bdud rtshi'i gzhan gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa/_rgya gar shar
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtshi'i gzhan gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa/_rgya gar shar
translated: The Realization of the Other Three of Vajra Amṛta,

original: phyogs kyi pan+di ta chen po nags kyi rin chen gyi zhal snga nas/_rdo rje bdud rtshi'i
analyzed: phyogs kyi pan+di ta chen po nags kyi rin chen gyi zhal snga nas/_rdo rje bdud rtshi'i
translated: Extracted from the Tantra of Vajra Amṛta by the great eastern Indian paṇḍita Vanaratna,

original: rgyud las phyung ba ste/_pan chen de nyid dang gzhon nu dpal gyis bsgyur ba'o////
analyzed: rgyud las phyung ba ste/_pan chen de nyid dang gzhon nu dpal gyis bsgyur ba'o////
translated: Translated by the great paṇḍita himself and Shönu Pal.

original: rdo rje bdud rtshi gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa/
analyzed: rdo rje bdud rtshi gsum gyi mngon par rtogs pa/
translated: The Realization of the Three Vajra Amṛtas
